meanings.definition: A group of people who settle in a new country or area.
meanings.sent1: The colony of settlers built a new town in the wilderness.
meanings.sent2: The Pilgrims established a colony in America for religious freedom.
meanings.sent3: The colony of friends decided to start a book club in their neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The colony of ants worked together to gather food for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The colony of bees buzzed busily around their hive.

meanings.definition: A group of animals or plants of the same type living together.
meanings.sent1: The coral reef is home to a colorful colony of fish.
meanings.sent2: The colony of penguins huddled together to stay warm in the cold.
meanings.sent3: The colony of sunflowers turned their heads towards the sun each day.
meanings.sent4: The colony of bacteria multiplied rapidly in the warm environment.
meanings.sent5: The colony of mushrooms spread across the forest floor.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are ruled by the government of another country.
meanings.sent1: The colony rebelled against the oppressive rule of the empire.
meanings.sent2: The British Empire once had a colony in India.
meanings.sent3: The colony of students protested against the strict school rules.
meanings.sent4: The colony of workers demanded better wages and working conditions.
meanings.sent5: The colony gained independence after years of struggle.
